figure_1.title: Figure 1. The cell cycle of events leading to the production of two daughter cells from a single parent cell.

figure_2.title: Figure 2. Endoscopic examination showing tongues of Barrett’s esophagus extending proximal to the gastroesophageal junction.

claims.sentence: The cell cycle (Figure 1) is the sequence of events leading to the production of two daughter cells from a single parent cell; it involves deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) replication and the division of the cell through processes of mitosis.
The endoscopic examination revealed a separation of the squamocolumnar junction and the gastroesophageal junction along with color changes from glossy white to salmon pink (Figure 2).

The cell cycle (Figure 1) is the sequence of events leading to the production of two daughter cells from a single parent cell; it involves deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) replication and the division of the cell through processes of mitosis.
The endoscopic examination revealed a separation of the squamocolumnar junction and the gastroesophageal junction along with color changes from glossy white to salmon pink (Figure 2).
